title: Four Property Portfolio Optimization

scenario_info.name: Four Property Portfolio Optimization
scenario_info.description: Victoria is selling her entire property portfolio in the 2024-25 financial year: her family home (main residence), a beach house (former main residence now rented), an investment unit (never lived in), and an inherited farm (from deceased parent). Strategic MRE nomination is critical to minimize total CGT.

expected_result.notes: After 50% discounts. Optimal strategy: Claim MRE on family home, use 2-year rule for farm.

applicable_rules: Property A: ITAA97 s118.110 - Full main residence exemption
Property B: ITAA97 s118.145 - Six-year rule exceeded (partial exemption)
Property B: ITAA97 s118.192 - First use to produce income
Property C: No exemption - pure investment property
Property D: ITAA97 s118.195 - Deceased estate 2-year rule
ITAA97 s115.25: 50% CGT discount applies to all taxable portions

property_history.description: Established as main residence - current family home

properties.notes: Property A - Family Home. FULL MRE applies. Main residence entire ownership (8.8 years). Capital gain ~$680,000. Taxable: $0.

property_history.description: Was main residence before moving to Noosa
Started renting (8.6 years - exceeds 6-year rule). Market value: $580,000

properties.notes: Property B - Beach House. PARTIAL MRE. Former main residence, rented 8.6 years (exceeds 6-year limit by 2.6 years). First use to produce income rule applies. Taxable gain after discount: $54,738.

property_history.description: Investment property - rented from day one, never lived in

properties.notes: Property C - Investment Unit. NO MRE. Pure investment from day one. Capital gain ~$75,000. Taxable after discount: $37,500.

property_history.description: Inherited from father. Was father's main residence.
Victoria receives property as beneficiary. Left vacant.

properties.notes: Property D - Inherited Farm. FULL EXEMPTION under 2-year rule. Was father's main residence, sold within 2 years (2.3 years, within extension). Capital gain ~$55,000. Taxable: $0.

user_query: I'm selling my entire property portfolio this year: my family home, a beach house I used to live in but have rented for 8 years, an investment unit, and a farm I inherited from my father. What's my total CGT?
